page.title: 13Mousehold Ground Cover
page.content: Mousehold Heath is near the centre of Norwich.It has sports facilities such as playing fields for football, cricket and a" pitch and putt" course. It is also used for for bike riding, running, horse riding and leisure walks with your family or dog. There is also a wide variety of wildlife, trees and plants. Most of the trees are deciduous, for example, Oak, Birch, Chestnuts and Ash. But some are conifers for instance, Scotch Pine and Alders. In and around the trees and plants there are squirrels, badgers, rabbits, hares and lots of birds including Long-tailed Tits, Blackbird, Sparrows, Blue -tits and Wood -pigeons. There is a network of paths leading through the heath. The paths are naturally made out of stones, earth, sand and mud. There are only three
